page.title: 01WARGRAVE AND ITS NEIGHBOURS
page.content:
{Wargrave,some of Crazies Hill,Shiplake {and surrounding district.} 46% Farmland 25% Residential 25% Woodland:deciduous, 4% coniferous {The River Thames}flows on its way from Reading to Henley making a loop to the East through Wargrave & Shiplake. This block of land in the valley is popular with tourists. Near to the M4, it has 2 British Rail Stations and its proximity to London and Reading is a reason for it being commuter country.
On the following pages you will find the results of research by children of Crazies Hill CE Primary School in the Summer 1985.The pages include: {Farming. The Vicar. The Parish Clerk {Lord Remnant. Local Health Care {Education. Home Life. Employment {Leisure activities. Village Festival {Demography. Police and Fire Services
